explanation: Agent A is correct. In the provided project mhd_assert is defined as '#define mhd_assert(ignore) ((void)0)'. Each invocation therefore expands to an expression statement that has no effect (e.g. '((void)0);'). Removing such a statement would not change program behaviour, so these are operations that are executed but are semantically inert — i.e. dead code under MISRA C:2023 Rule 2.2. (The same observation applies to other no-op idioms such as '(void)unif_buf_used;' which are used purely to silence warnings.) If, instead, mhd_assert is active in some build configurations (expands to real checks) then those configurations would not contain dead code; but given the definition shown in the scenario, the report of a Rule 2.2 violation is correct.
